Record Title: Apple Has First Earning Decline in More Than a Decade
MetaData (keywords): Product life cycle; Kotler, Marketing Principles, 16th Edition; Keller, Marketing Management, 15th Edition; Armstrong, Marketing: An Introduction, 13th Edition; Solomon, Marketing: Real People, Real Choices, 8th Edition
Video Info: After watching the video, answer the following multiple choice questions.
MCQ #1: The recent decrease in iPhone sales most likely indicates that the company's products are in the ______ stage of the product life cycle.
MCQ#2: ______ is the most likely reason that iPhone sales decreased during the previous quarter, and why Apple will be launching its newest iPhone soon.
MCQ#3: During the time the iPhone brought in high profits and sales peaked, it was most likely in the _______ stage of the product life cycle.
MCQ#4: The first customers to purchase the original iPhone as soon as it hit the market are most likely classified as which type of adopters?
MCQ#5: As sales decline for the current iPhone, which is the most likely course of action for Apple regarding pricing of the iPhone?
Q5 Distracter B: Apple with match or beat competitor prices.

Record Title: How Does Barbara Corcoran Pick Her Investments on Shark Tank?
MetaData (keywords): Nonverbal; Poise; Posture; Delivery; Interviewing. Gender bias; Cultural bias; Cultural variations; Cultural differences; Bias-free language; Connotative; Abstractions; Plain language; Shark Tank; Barbara Corcoran; Bovee; Thill; Excellence in Business Communication; Business Communication Today; Business Communication Essentials; Shwom; Snyder; Business Communication
Video Info:
1.Watch the following video about the communication factors that sway a venture capitalist's investment decisions and how she overcomes speaker's anxiety. 

2.Answer the multiple choice questions that appear after the video.
MCQ #1: In the first moments of Shark Tank, entrepreneurs arrive on the stage. Barbara Corcoran says that their body language shows that they are eager to make a pitch. Which of the following nonverbal cues convey that message?
Q1 Correct Answer: They walk in confidently, make great eye contact, and stand erect and poised.
Q1 Distracter A: They walk hesitantly toward the spotlight and squint in the bright lights.
Q1 Distracter B: They saunter onto the stage with their hands in their pockets.
Q1 Distracter C: They move to the center of the stage and stand with pained expression on their faces.
Q1 Distracter D: They walk onto the stage and study their notes.
MCQ#2: The entrepreneurs are told to be silent until they are spoken to. During the long silence, Barbara Corcoran says she learns who can handle pressure. How?
Q2 Correct Answer: She watches the nonverbal cues, looking for deflated body posture, fidgeting, and loss of poise.
Q2 Distracter A: She finds out who can follow directions.
Q2 Distracter B: She discovers whether the candidates can use their time wisely.
Q2 Distracter C: She assesses whether the candidates have good manners.
Q2 Distracter D: She counts how many times the candidates blink.
MCQ#3: Consider the choice of words in the statement, If you want to get in bed with a great entrepreneur, he better be good under pressure.What are the communication implications of this choice of words?
Q3 Correct Answer: All of the answer choices are true.
Q3 Distracter A: All of the answer choices are true.
Q3 Distracter B: The statement has inappropriate sexual overtones.
Q3 Distracter C: The connotative meaning could be unclear to those not familiar with the slang use of the phrases
Q3 Distracter D: The word choice illustrates why concrete, plain words are more professional.
MCQ#4: Barbara Corcoran admits to feeling insecure and anxious during public performances, including appearances on Shark Tank. What technique does she recommend to overcome the fear of public speaking?
Q4 Correct Answer: Boost your confidence with affirming statements.
Q4 Distracter A: Wait for the anxiety to pass before beginning.
Q4 Distracter D: Remind yourself of embarrassing and unskillful presentations.
MCQ#5: Barbara Corcoran says that when she is hesitant to speak in a high-pressure situation, she says to herself, What would a man do? And I do it. I raise my hand. I demand what I want.This illustrates what aspect of gender influences in workplace communication?
Q5 Correct Answer: Men and women tend to have different communication styles.
Q5 Distracter A: Women tend to emphasize content and outcomes in their communication efforts.
Q5 Distracter B: Men tend to place a higher premium on relationships.
Q5 Distracter C: Men and women view assertiveness as a negative quality in men and a positive quality in women.
Q5 Distracter D: Gender plays a minor role in workplace communication.

Record Title: World Leaders Address Counterterrorism at Summit
MetaData (keywords): Global Nuclear Security; Counterterrorism; Cross-National Cooperation; World Nuclear Powers; USA; President Obama; Russia; ISIS; Cyber Security; International Business: Environments & Operations; Daniels; International Business: The Challenges of Globalization; Wild; Business: A Managerial Perspective; Griffin; International Business: The New Realities; Cavusgil
Video Info:
1. Watch the following video, which shows an ABC report on how President Obama is hosting a summit for world leaders on counterterrorism and nuclear weapons.
2. Answer the multiple choice questions that appear after the video.
MCQ #1: How many world leaders will be attending President Obama's summit?
MCQ#2: The main focus of this summit is to keep nuclear weapons out of whose hands?
MCQ#3: The video highlights that this summit is more pressing because of which recent international incident?
Q3 Distracter A: The downing of a Russian plane by Turkey
Q3 Distracter C: The sinking of a Japanese fishing vessel by North Korea
Q3 Distracter D: The derailment of a train carrying nuclear waste across Montana
MCQ#4: A significant global player who decided to boycott this summit was
MCQ#5: Getting a commitment from the leaders in this summit is very important to President Obama right now because ______.
Q5 Correct Answer: it is the last summit of this type before he leaves office
Q5 Distracter A: most of the world leaders are getting pretty old
Q5 Distracter B: the United Nations is about to change the rules for these types of summits
Q5 Distracter C: democratic governments are being replaced by totalitarian ones
Q5 Distracter D: the nuclear stockpiles are suddenly becoming very unstable

Record Title: High Fashion, Deadly Factories
Video Info:
1.        Watch the following news report about an investigation into high fashion clothing factories. Be advised that the report includes vivid scenes of a deadly fire. Consider the communication challenges companies face when confronted with negative news. 

2.        Answer the multiple choice questions that appear after the video.
MCQ #1: The newscaster's lead-in to Brian Ross's report states that it may well leave you heartbroken and outraged.This wording employs which aspect(s) of language?
MCQ#2: Tommy Hilfiger told ABC News that his Bangladesh factories meet the gold standard,despite a deadly fire. Then, his staff ordered the news crew off the property. When a company faces negative news, how should it respond?
Q2 Correct Answer: All of the answer choices are correct.
Q2 Distracter A: Be prepared for trouble ahead of time.
Q2 Distracter B: Do not refuse to answer questions.
MCQ#3: Tommy Hilfiger said his company had pulled out of Bangladesh, saying, We will never manufacture clothes in those factories ever again.When the statement proved false, what would communications specialists recommend as the next step?
Q3 Correct Answer: Assume full responsibility for the miscommunication.
Q3 Distracter C: Publicize company safeguards to prevent problems.
Q3 Distracter D: Avoid interviews in hopes the publicity will die down.
MCQ#4: Some experts advise that a company should never apologize, even when it knows it has made a mistake. What is the main concern?
Q4 Correct Answer: The apology might be taken as a confession of guilt that could be used against the company in a lawsuit.
Q4 Distracter A: Apologies play no strategic role in running a business.
Q4 Distracter B: The apology might make the executive appear weak, which could be a disadvantage in future negotiations.
Q4 Distracter C: The apology could reinforce the negative situation, damaging the company's reputation.
Q4 Distracter D: Apologies could hurt the company's relationships with its stakeholders.
MCQ#5: Hilfiger and its parent company announced a $2 million plan for an independent fire inspector in Bangladesh to enforce new, strict regulations. Which principle of crisis communication does this action best illustrate?
Q5 Distracter A: Tell the story completely and honestly.
Q5 Distracter B: Provide a buffer to the bad news.
Q5 Distracter D: Establish common ground with the public.

Record Title: Historic Climate Deal Reached
Video Info:
1.        Watch the following video, which captures the signing of the most impactful global agreement on climate change ever signed.
2.        Answer the multiple choice questions that appear after the video.
MCQ #1: The societal issue that this agreement addresses is specifically related to
MCQ#2: This agreement is significant because of the number of countries that signed it. How many were there in total?
MCQ#3: As part of the agreement, each country is required to _______.
Q3 Distracter A: pay a lump sum amount to the World Bank
Q3 Distracter B: reduce their use of electricity by 15%

Q4 Distracter C: will be voted down in the U.S. Congress
Q4 Distracter D: has goals that cannot really be achieved
